description.value:
Gathering for the Departed
Rite of Death • Level 1

Time: 1 hour
Cost: 1 Gnosis
Requirement: The body, remains, or a personal item of the deceased Garou

Description

The Gathering for the Departed is performed to honor a recently fallen Garou and guide their spirit toward rest. Through shared memory, howls, and remembrance, the living acknowledge both loss and legacy.

This Rite does not summon the dead. It allows the dead to be acknowledged and released.

Effect

When the Gnosis cost is paid, the Rite succeeds automatically.

Upon completion:

  • The spirit of the deceased Garou is formally released from lingering emotional ties to the living world
  • The deceased cannot unintentionally linger, manifest, or become a restless spirit due to unresolved grief or unfinished remembrance
  • The Rite establishes the deceased as properly honored, preventing their spirit from being exploited or bound through minor necromantic or spiritual effects

In addition, each Garou who participated in the Rite may choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until the end of their next long rest:

  • Gain advantage on one Wisdom saving throw made to resist fear, despair, or supernatural dread
  • Gain advantage on one Charisma-based ability check made to console, inspire, or support another creature

These benefits do not stack and expire unused.

Limitations

This Rite:

  • Does not contact or summon the deceased
  • Does not prevent powerful magic from interacting with the soul
  • Does not provide combat bonuses
  • The Rite must be performed within one Caern Turn of the Garou's death to gain its full effect
  • A given death may only be honored by this Rite once
